intro: Syringa vulgaris f. albipleniflora, commonly known as the white-flowered lilac, is a cultivar of the common lilac characterized by its abundant, fragrant, white flowers. It belongs to the Oleaceae family and is native to eastern Europe and western Asia. The plant is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 2–6 meters, featuring opposite, simple, and ovate leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing a showy display that attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies.
